title: Metropolitan Police expected to be heavily criticised for being racist, sexist and homophobic in report
description: The BBC understands the report will criticise the Met's tolerance of wrongdoing within its ranks.

title: Six Nations 2023: England's Henry Arundell has an 'incredible future', says Steve Borthwick
description: England head coach Steve Borthwick says Henry Arundell has an "incredible future" after handing the wing a first Test start against Ireland on Saturday.

title: Arsenal 1-1 Sporting Lisbon: Arsenal knocked out of Europa League in penalty shootout defeat
description: Arsenal are knocked out of the Europa League following a penalty shootout defeat by Sporting Lisbon.

title: West Ham United 4-0 AEK Larnaca (Agg: 6-0): Hammers into Europa Conference League last eight
description: Jarrod Bowen scores two goals in two second-half minutes as West Ham United beat AEK Larnaca in Europa Conference League.

title: France pension protests: Clashes after Macron orders rise in pension age without vote
description: France's president has sidelined MPs and forced through plans to raise the pension age from 62 to 64.

title: Harry Maguire: Manchester United captain says he has 'important role' to play
description: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire says he has "an important role" to play after the Red Devils reach the Europa League quarter-finals.

title: Protests in Paris as Macron pushes through pension reform in France
description: The French government has invoked a power that means no vote is needed for the reforms to go ahead.

title: Chris Kaba family concerned about watchdog resignations
description: Chris Kaba, 24, was shot dead by a Met Police officer and the police watchdog is investigating.

title: Real Betis 0-1 Manchester United (Agg:1-5): Marcus Rashford scores as visitors reach Europa League quarter-finals
description: Marcus Rashford is on target again as Manchester United cruise into the quarter-finals of the Europa League.

title: Breast cancer gene linked to Orkney islands
description: A gene variant known to increase the risk of breast cancer has been found in people with Orkney heritage.

title: More than half of England's schools disrupted by strikes
description: Teachers walked out for two days this week in their long-running dispute over a fully-funded pay rise.

title: Cheltenham Gold Cup 2023: A Plus Tard, Galopin Des Champs, Bravemansgame among runners
description: Rachael Blackmore will bid for a repeat on A Plus Tard in Friday's Cheltenham Gold Cup after making history 12 months ago.

title: Six Nations 2023: Henry Arundell starts with Owen Farrell at fly-half against Ireland
description: Wing Henry Arundell will make his first England start while Owen Farrell returns at fly-half for their final Six Nations game against Ireland.

title: Mounted police ride after driver holding his phone
description: Two mounted police officers ride after a man holding his phone while driving through a town centre.

title: Leila Borrington: Woman jailed for killing three-year-old stepson
description: Harvey Borrington was non-verbally autistic and therefore could not tell of Leila Borrington's abuse.

title: Saudi Arabian Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton and other F1 drivers uncomfortable returning to Jeddah
description: Lewis Hamilton and a number of fellow Formula 1 drivers have made it clear they are uncomfortable about being back in Saudi Arabia.

title: Strictly judge Motsi Mabuse says she can't understand northern accents
description: Motsi Mabuse says she needs fellow Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood's help with northern accents.

title: England: Gareth Southgate sticks with players he trusts for Euro 2024 qualifiers against Italy and Ukraine
description: England manager Gareth Southgate believes nothing needs fixing as he names a familiar squad for the Euro 2024 qualifiers against Italy and Ukraine.

title: NHS 5% pay offer may end bitter dispute in England
description: Unions urge members, including nurses and ambulance staff, to back deal which includes one-off payment.

title: Cheltenham Festival 2023: Envoi Allen and Sire Du Berlais triumph
description: Envoi Allen wins the Ryanair Chase at the Cheltenham Festival for Rachael Blackmore and Henry de Bromhead while 33-1 shot Sire Du Berlais lands the Stayers' Hurdle.

title: SNP says its membership has fallen to 72,000
description: The party has revealed its current membership numbers amid a row over the conduct of its leadership race.

title: Microsoft brings ChatGPT-style tech to Office365
description: The tech giant reveals how AI will be embedded into Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Teams.

title: Doris and Sheehan fit for Grand-Slam chasing Ireland against England
description: Caelan Doris and Dan Sheehan are passed fit to start for Grand Slam-chasing Ireland in Saturday's Six Nations contest against England.

title: Budget 2023: Childcare funding and other Jeremy Hunt claims checked
description: The chancellor also made claims about immigration and surgeons working fewer hours.

title: Budget back to work plan 'to cost £70,000 per job'
description: The chancellor's schemes will only recruit small numbers at a high cost per job, a think tank forecasts.

title: France's Macron to force through pension reform with no vote
description: The French government will use the constitution to push through a pension age rise from 62 to 64.

title: 2023 Women's World Cup: Fifa drops Visit Saudi sponsorship for tournament
description: Fifa drops plans for Saudi Arabia to sponsor the 2023 Women's World Cup in Australia and New Zealand, president Gianni Infantino confirms.

title: Snapchat stabber found guilty of murdering Kyle Walley
description: Mark Jones, 20, posted footage of his 19-year-old victim online after stabbing him with a knife.

title: Dane van Niekerk: South Africa all-rounder retires from international cricket
description: Former South Africa captain Dane van Niekerk retires from international cricket "with great sadness".

title: Euro 2024 qualifiers: Ivan Toney in England squad for games against Italy and Ukraine
description: England manager Gareth Southgate picks striker Ivan Toney in his squad for the Euro 2024 qualifiers against Italy and Ukraine this month.

title: Lineker thought he had special BBC Twitter agreement - agent
description: The football presenter believed he was allowed to tweet about refugee rights, his representative says.

title: Cheltenham stab suspect 'believed woman worked at GCHQ' - court told
description: Joshua Bowles, 29, is accused of attempted murder and causing actual bodily harm.

title: Security building on fire in Russia's Rostov-on-Don
description: One person dies in the blaze in a federal security service building in the southern Russian city.

title: Video shows moment Russian fighter jet hits US drone over Black Sea
description: US footage shows the jet apparently dumping fuel as it makes two close passes with the drone.

title: Watch the harrowing rescue of a man stuck in a flooded river
description: US firefighters hoist him to safety as he clings on to a barrier in the flooded Los Angeles River.

title: People urged to take gonorrhoea tests as cases rise
description: Sexually active people are warned as cases of the sexually transmitted disease rise sharply in England.

title: Six Nations 2023: Taulupe Faletau to win 100th Wales cap against France
description: Taulupe Faletau will win his 100th Wales cap in Paris when he faces France in the Six Nations finale on Saturday.

title: TikTok to be banned on UK government phones
description: The company has denied passing users' information to the Chinese government.

title: Midhurst fire: Historic hotel 'housing refugees' engulfed by blaze
description: The fire is believed to have started in a property in Midhurst before spreading to the Angel Inn.

title: Watch: The moment a Russian jet hits a US drone
description: The US military says the jet hit the drone on Tuesday, causing it to later crash into the Black Sea.

title: Six Nations: Smith, Kinghorn, Watson & Skinner replace big names for Scotland
description: Ollie Smith and Blair Kinghorn will start in place of Stuart Hogg and Finn Russell for Scotland's final Six Nations match against Italy.

title: Budget 2023: Pensions tax cut for wealthy is wrong priority, Labour says
description: The party says it would reverse changes to pensions announced in the Budget, arguing they benefit the wealthy.

title: John Lewis axes staff bonus again as losses surge
description: The department store operator and Waitrose owner says shoppers 'felt the pain of inflation'.

title: Cocaine production reaches record levels as new trafficking hubs emerge
description: After Covid lockdowns hit both demand and supply, production is at record levels, the UN says.

title: Rishabh Pant replaced by David Warner as Delhi Capitals captain for IPL
description: Rishabh Pant is replaced by David Warner as Delhi Capitals captain for this year's IPL as the India wicketkeeper recovers from a car crash.

title: Megan Newborough: Murdered woman's family stunned by sentence decision
description: The 23-year-old's family say her killer deserves a longer jail term before he is considered for release.

title: Daniil Medvedev: Russian 'feels sorry' for Ukrainian players on tour during war
description: Russia's world number six Daniil Medvedev says he "feels sorry" for Ukrainian players competing on the tours amid the ongoing war in the country.

title: Credit Suisse emergency loan sparks banking fears
description: Stock markets across Asia fall as troubles at Credit Suisse sparked fears of a wider banking crisis.

title: Evacuated Afghan women's team included 'false' footballers
description: Women footballers evacuated to the UK included some who were not the top players it was claimed.

title: In Bakhmut Russian casualties mount but tactics evolve
description: The BBC has been given access to positions held by Ukrainian army brigades defending Bakhmut's southern flank.

title: With Quentin Sommerville near the frontline in Bakhmut
description: The BBC joins Ukrainian soldiers just 500 metres from Russian forces as they battle for the city in the Donbas region.

title: Jermain Defoe: The goal which was so good it made him cry
description: Ex-England striker Jermain Defoe relives his spectacular winning goal for Sunderland against Newcastle in 2015, and explains why it made him cry.

title: MOTDx: Arsenal’s Bukayo Saka & Eddie Nketiah play Red Card, Yellow Card
description: Arsenal's Bukayo Saka and Eddie Nketiah dish out red and yellow cards for various football and real-life dilemmas, such as whether pairing socks and sliders is OK.

title: Virgin Orbit to pause all operations from Thursday
description: The decision comes after the failure of the first ever satellite mission launched from the UK.

title: Unions close to pay deal with government to avert more NHS strikes
description: An agreement on health workers' pay could be announced as early as Thursday afternoon.

title: World's first octopus farm proposals alarm scientists
description: Methods used on the Spanish farm would be "cruel" to such intelligent animals say experts, as details emerge.

title: Drought risk to England regions after dry February, scientists warn
description: Parts of England could face drought conditions again without sustained rain in coming weeks.

title: HS2 delays are prolonging our agony, say Staffordshire farmers
description: People whose families have farmed land for generations say they are in a "dreadful situation".

title: Chris Mason: Pension perks likely next political flashpoint
description: The end of the cap on tax-free pension savings could yet prove totemic, writes our political editor.

title: The Papers: Hunt 'defies gloom' and 'Giveaway for the 1%'
description: Reaction to Jeremy Hunt's first Budget as chancellor dominates Thursday's papers.

title: PinkPantheress on chart success and hearing loss: 'I did my mourning already'
description: The star, who lost 80% of the hearing in her right ear, says she's come to terms with her condition.

title: SNP leader candidates call for 'robust' audit of vote system
description: Teams for Kate Forbes and Ash Regan believe party members and the public need reassurance over the ballot.

title: The doctors selling false hope to people facing blindness
description: A BBC reporter goes undercover and confronts doctors offering bogus treatments for his genetic condition.

title: Why sleeper trains are being revived across Europe
description: A number of rail operators are launching new sleeper train services across the continent.

title: Linfield footballer Ross Larkin 'lucky to be alive' after cancer
description: Northern Ireland under-21 defender Ross Larkin had a brain tumour just before Christmas 2021.
